title: ICE: index out of bounds: the len is 1 but the index is 1: layout.rs

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust // build-pass // compile-flags: -Z mir-opt-level=3 #![crate_type="lib"] #![feature(lang_items)] #![no_std] #[lang = "owned_box"] pub struct Box(*mut T); impl Drop for Box { fn drop(&mut self) { } } #[lang = "box_free"] #[inline(always)] unsafe fn box_free(ptr: *mut T) { dealloc(ptr) } #[inline(never)] fn dealloc(_: *mut T) { } pub struct Foo(T); pub fn foo(a: Option>>) -> usize { let f = match a { None => Foo(0), Some(vec) => *vec, }; f.0 } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.62.0-nightly (ec77f2524 2022-04-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: ec77f252434a532fdb5699ae4f21a3072d211edd commit-date: 2022-04-17 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.62.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
